intro: Hebanthe subnuda, commonly known as the naked hebanthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, clustered in small inflorescences, and bloom during the rainy season. Hebanthe subnuda is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
